summary: This is an email chain from September 17, 2019, regarding the continued investigation into possible collaborators of Jeffrey Epstein. An Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York acknowledges receipt of materials from the New Mexico Attorney General's Office, which are being shared via a secure link and a mailed CD.

persons.name: Zach Jones
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding the investigation into Epstein's collaborators.

persons.name: Clara Moran
persons.context: Sent the attached correspondence and materials regarding the investigation into Epstein's collaborators; copied on the email.

connections.description: Moran is sharing investigative materials with Jones, indicating a professional, inter-agency collaboration on the Epstein case.

events.title: Sharing of Investigative Materials
events.description: The New Mexico Attorney General's Office shares materials regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's possible collaborators with the Southern District of New York.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's possible collaborators was active and involved inter-agency cooperation as of September 2019.
The New Mexico Attorney General's Office (via Clara Moran) was sharing sensitive materials with the U.S. Attorney's Office in the Southern District of New York.
Materials were shared via a secure, expiring link (password-protected) and a physical CD sent via U.S. Mail.
The document reference 'NMAG Lies' appears to be a label for the shared materials.
